Description: Amuletic pendant charm consisting of a red plastic "hand" to which are attached, by metal rings, four further charms in coloured plastic including a fish and a horse shoe. On the back of the "hand" is depicted the mosque of Said al-Bedawy at Tanta in the Nile delta.
Curator's comments: Eth.Doc.120. Purchased at the mulid of al-Hussein, Cairo, November 1990.
Acquisition notes: Af1991,06.1 to 5 were purchased from Delia Pemberton. All the objects are recorded in the purchase book as having been purchased by the vendor in Cairo, Luxor or Abydos in November 1990. See Eth.Doc.120.
